Pact under the Government Capacity Building and Support (GCBS) activity will support the Department of Social Development (DSD) nationally to strengthen their response in addressing social and structural barriers that increase the vulnerability of OVC to HIV, STIs, and TB and in addressing specific constraints hampering the health and social development systems to achieve better outcomes for OVC. Funds allocated for Program Element HL.1.8: Orphans and Vulnerable Children. Activities are aimed at improving the lives of orphans and other vulnerable children (OVC) affected by HIV/AIDS, and doing so in a measurable way. Funds allocated for Program Element HL.1.13: Health System Strengthening. Include activities that contribute to national, regional or district level systems by supporting finance, leadership and governance (include broad policy reform efforts including stigma, gender, etc.), institutional capacity building, supply chain or procurement systems, Global Fund programs and donor coordination. objectives

Pact under the Government Capacity Building and Support (GCBS) activity will support the Department of Social Development (DSD) nationally to strengthen their response in addressing social and structural barriers that increase the vulnerability of OVC to HIV, STIs, and TB and in addressing specific constraints hampering the health and social development systems to achieve better outcomes for OVC. Technical assistance and capacity-building activities will focus on six core components responding to: improving coordination, collaboration, understanding and overall management and implementation of services; redressing the overall management and operational process within DSD; refining HIV behavior-change models and increasing reach; strengthening the overall child protection system to meet the needs of vulnerable children; and, strengthening the social welfare workforce. Activities will include: the development of improved delivery models; leadership and good governance oversight; review and modify relevant policies, procedures and guidelines; development of training materials; research to inform practice; and, strengthening of data collection, monitoring, evaluation and reporting mechanisms nationally and provincially. DSD will be supported to operationalize the National Action Plan (NAP) and related policies to improve service delivery to OVC and to improve their involvement in national structures, e.g. South African National AIDS Council (SANAC). Support will be provided at all levels (national, provincial, district) and will be in partnership with DSD to strengthen systems overall and ensure sustainability. Monitoring and evaluations plans will be developed to ensure that the overall goals are met.
